itemDescription: British writer, theatre producer and director

wikipedia_page.main: Ernest Carpenter Elmore (4 November, 1901 – 8 November, 1957) was an English theatre producer and director, and writer of crime and fantasy novels. He wrote his crime novels under the pseudonym John Bude.

response: * Ernest Elmore, (1901–1957) author of The Lumpton Gobbelings
*November 4 – Ernest Elmore (John Bude), English crime writer and theatre director (died 1957)
*November 8 – Ernest Elmore (John Bude), English crime writer and theatre director (born 1901)
*John Bude (1901–1957, E), pseudonym of Ernest Elmore
*Ernest Elmore, English theater producer and crime/fantasy writer

The world-famous "Gonzo" illustrator Ralph Steadman lives in Old Loose Court, just outside the parish and the 'Beechgrove Garden' (BBC Scotland) presenter Carole Baxter was born there. The novelist Ernest Elmore (who also wrote as John Bude) lived in Loose in the 1930s.Catalog of Copyright Entries. New Series: 1931, Part 1 (Washington, DC: Library of Congress), p. 2054. The artist and calligrapher Mildred Ratcliffe (1899-1988) retired to the cottage at 1, Mill Street, in 1959. She painted a number of the village's buildings.
*Ernest Elmore (1901–1957) – writer of fantasy and (as John Bude) crime novels
*Ernest Elmore (1901–1957), theatre producer, director, writer (as "John Bude"). Died in Hastings.
